summary.en: REM usually means the rapid eye movement stage of sleep; it can also refer to the band R.E.M.
summary.zh: REM通常指睡眠中的“快速眼动期”；也可指摇滚乐队R.E.M.。

definition.en: Rapid eye movement: a stage of sleep when your eyes move quickly under your eyelids and most vivid dreaming happens.
definition.zh: 快速眼动（睡眠）：睡眠的一个阶段，眼球在眼皮下快速移动，常出现最生动的梦。

examples.en: Most vivid dreams happen during REM sleep.
examples.zh: 最生动的梦通常发生在REM睡眠阶段。

examples.en: The doctor said my REM was shortened because of stress.
examples.zh: 医生说因为压力，我的REM阶段变短了。

definition.en: R.E.M.: an American alternative rock band known for songs like “Losing My Religion.”
definition.zh: R.E.M.：美国另类摇滚乐队，以《Losing My Religion》等歌曲闻名。

examples.en: My dad still listens to R.E.M. on road trips.
examples.zh: 我爸在自驾旅行时还会听R.E.M.。

examples.en: “Losing My Religion” is one of R.E.M.’s most famous songs.
examples.zh: 《Losing My Religion》是R.E.M.最有名的歌之一。

extraExplanation: REM是缩写，全称是 rapid eye movement。日常生活中常说“REM sleep（快速眼动睡眠）”，它和“non-REM sleep（非快速眼动睡眠）”一起构成睡眠周期。
写作时常见两种形式：REM（谈睡眠阶段）以及R.E.M.（指乐队名，带点号更常见）。

summary.en: “rem” most commonly refers to a CSS unit based on the root font size, or to REM sleep (rapid eye movement).
summary.zh: “rem”最常见指基于根字体大小的 CSS 单位，或指快速眼动睡眠（REM）。

definition.en: a CSS length unit equal to the root element’s font size (usually the <html> font size), used to make designs scale consistently
definition.zh: CSS 的长度单位，等于根元素（通常是 <html>）的字体大小，用于让页面尺寸更一致、易缩放

examples.en: Set the body text to 1rem so it matches the root font size.
examples.zh: 把正文文字设为 1rem，这样就和根字体大小一致。

examples.en: Padding of 2rem will grow if the user increases the base font size.
examples.zh: 如果用户调大基础字体，2rem 的内边距也会跟着变大。

definition.en: REM sleep: a stage of sleep when the eyes move rapidly and vivid dreaming often happens (REM = rapid eye movement)
definition.zh: 快速眼动睡眠：睡眠阶段之一，眼球快速移动，常伴随清晰的梦境（REM = rapid eye movement）

examples.en: Adults usually cycle through several periods of REM sleep each night.
examples.zh: 成年人一晚通常会经历几个快速眼动睡眠周期。

examples.en: She woke up during REM and remembered her dream clearly.
examples.zh: 她在快速眼动睡眠时醒来，把梦记得很清楚。

extraExplanation: 在网页开发里，rem 常用来做“响应式”设计：和 px（固定像素）相比，rem 会跟着根字体大小一起缩放，因此更利于无障碍（例如用户放大字体）。
注意大小写：网页单位通常写作“rem”（小写）；睡眠术语常写作“REM”（大写缩写）。

summary.en: “Remade” means “made again” or “created as a new version,” and it is also the past form of “remake.”
summary.zh: “remade”表示“重新制作/改版”，也是“remake”的过去式和过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “remake” (to make again, or to create a new version of something).
definition.zh: “remake”的过去式和过去分词（再做一次；或把某物重新制作成新版本）。

examples.en: She remade the bed after washing the sheets.
examples.zh: 她洗完床单后又重新铺了床。

examples.en: The studio remade the movie for a new audience.
examples.zh: 片方为新的观众群体重拍了这部电影。

definition.en: made again; produced in a new form or version.
definition.zh: 重新制作的；改版的。

examples.en: This is a remade edition with clearer photos and updated text.
examples.zh: 这是重新制作的版本，照片更清晰，文字也更新了。

examples.en: The remade logo looks more modern.
examples.zh: 重新设计后的标志看起来更现代。

extraExplanation: “remake”常用于两类场景：①把同一个东西重新做一遍（remake the bed / remake a sandwich）；②把作品“翻拍/重制”（remake a film / remake a game）。在影视语境里更自然的说法有“a remake”（名词：翻拍片）。
拼写提示：remake（原形）→ remade（过去式/过去分词），不是“remaked”。

summary.en: Remagnetization means restoring or redoing magnetism in a material; in geology, it can also mean a rock acquiring a new magnetic record that replaces an older one.
summary.zh: Remagnetization 指材料磁性的恢复或重新磁化；在地质学中也可指岩石获得新的磁性记录，从而取代旧记录。

definition.en: the process of making a material magnetic again, or restoring its magnetism after it has weakened or been removed
definition.zh: 再磁化；重新使材料具有磁性，或在磁性减弱/消失后恢复其磁性

examples.en: After heating the steel too much, they used remagnetization to restore its magnetic strength.
examples.zh: 钢材加热过度后，他们通过再磁化来恢复它的磁力强度。

examples.en: The technician tested the motor parts and recommended remagnetization instead of replacement.
examples.zh: 技术员检测了电机零件，并建议再磁化而不是直接更换。

definition.en: (physics/geology) the recording of a new magnetic direction in a rock or material, replacing an older magnetic signature
definition.zh: （物理/地质）再磁化作用；岩石或材料记录新的磁化方向，从而覆盖旧的磁性记录

examples.en: Geologists checked the rock sample for signs of remagnetization caused by later heating.
examples.zh: 地质学家检查岩石样品是否有后期加热导致的再磁化迹象。

examples.en: Remagnetization can make it harder to study the original magnetic history of a region.
examples.zh: 再磁化会让研究某个地区最初的磁性历史变得更困难。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：re-（再、重新）+ magnetize（使磁化）+ -ation（名词后缀），整体表示“再次磁化/重新磁化”的过程。
常见搭配：remagnetization of a magnet（磁体的再磁化）、thermal remagnetization（热再磁化）、remanent magnetization（剩磁；与再磁化研究常相关）。
使用场景：工程上常指对磁铁、电机部件等“恢复磁力”；地球科学里常用于讨论岩石因加热、化学变化等导致的“后期磁性重置”。

summary.en: Remagnetize means to make something magnetic again or to regain magnetism.
summary.zh: Remagnetize 指使某物重新具有磁性，或（某物）恢复磁性。

definition.en: to make something magnetic again (or restore its magnetic strength).
definition.zh: 使……重新带磁（或恢复磁性/磁力）。

examples.en: The technician remagnetized the screwdriver so it could hold small screws.
examples.zh: 技师把螺丝刀重新磁化，这样它就能吸住小螺丝了。

examples.en: After the motor overheated, the shop tried to remagnetize the rotor.
examples.zh: 电机过热后，维修店尝试让转子重新磁化。

definition.en: to become magnetic again or regain magnetism.
definition.zh: 重新带磁；恢复磁性。

examples.en: Some materials can remagnetize when they cool down.
examples.zh: 有些材料在冷却后会重新带磁。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”；“magnetize”表示“使……磁化”。在日常英语里更常见的是“magnetize/demagnetize（磁化/消磁）”，而“remagnetize”多出现在维修、工程、物理等语境。
常见搭配：remagnetize a screwdriver / remagnetize a motor / remagnetize a magnet（重新磁化螺丝刀/电机/磁体）。

summary.en: “Remagnetized” means “made magnetic again / had magnetism restored.”
summary.zh: “remagnetized”表示“再次磁化/恢复磁性”。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “remagnetize”: to make something magnetic again, or to restore/strengthen its magnetism.
definition.zh: “remagnetize”的过去式/过去分词：使某物再次被磁化，或恢复/增强其磁性。

examples.en: The technician remagnetized the motor’s rotor to improve performance.
examples.zh: 技术人员给电机转子重新磁化以提升性能。

examples.en: After years of use, the screwdriver tip was remagnetized so it could hold screws again.
examples.zh: 使用多年后，螺丝刀头被重新磁化，这样又能吸住螺丝了。

definition.en: describing something that has been made magnetic again or had its magnetism restored.
definition.zh: 形容某物已被重新磁化，磁性已恢复或增强。

examples.en: The remagnetized strip worked normally in the reader.
examples.zh: 重新磁化后的磁条在读卡器里正常工作。

examples.en: They tested the remagnetized samples under the same conditions.
examples.zh: 他们在相同条件下测试了重新磁化的样品。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”。“magnetize”是“使……磁化”，所以“remagnetize”常见于工程、材料科学、电机维修等语境。
重新磁化通常涉及让材料处在强磁场中，使内部“磁畴”更一致，从而恢复或增强磁性。日常生活中常见例子是把螺丝刀头重新磁化，方便吸住螺丝。

summary.en: Remagnetizing means restoring magnetism to something or making it magnetic again.
summary.zh: Remagnetizing 指让某物恢复磁性或再次具有磁性。

definition.en: the process of making something magnetic again, or restoring its magnetism after it has weakened or been removed
definition.zh: 使某物再次具有磁性；在磁性减弱或消失后恢复其磁性（的过程）

examples.en: The technician is remagnetizing the screwdriver tip so it can hold small screws.
examples.zh: 技师正在给螺丝刀头重新磁化，这样它就能吸住小螺丝。

examples.en: Remagnetizing old magnets can improve how well the device works.
examples.zh: 对旧磁铁重新磁化可以提升设备的工作效果。

definition.en: making something magnetic again; restoring magnetism to an object (present participle/gerund of “remagnetize”)
definition.zh: 重新磁化；使某物恢复磁性（“remagnetize”的现在分词/动名词用法）

examples.en: They are remagnetizing the motor’s rotor to restore its performance.
examples.zh: 他们正在给电机转子重新磁化，以恢复性能。

examples.en: Remagnetizing a tape head requires careful equipment and safety steps.
examples.zh: 重新磁化磁带机磁头需要谨慎的设备和安全步骤。

extraExplanation: “remagnetizing”常见于物理、工程与维修语境，尤其涉及磁铁、马达转子、传感器等部件。
有时物体会因高温、强撞击或强反向磁场而“退磁”（demagnetize）。重新磁化通常通过外加磁场（如使用线圈通电）来实现。
相关词：magnetize（磁化）、demagnetize（退磁/消磁）、remanence（剩磁）。

summary.en: Remagnification means magnifying an image again or further, usually in technical imaging contexts.
summary.zh: Remagnification 指对图像再次或进一步放大，常用于较专业的成像语境。

definition.en: the act or process of magnifying something again (or further), especially an image that has already been enlarged (e.g., in microscopy, photography, printing, or digital imaging).
definition.zh: 再次放大；二次放大（尤指对已放大过的图像在显微、摄影、印刷或数码成像中进一步放大）。

examples.en: The technician used remagnification to examine a tiny crack that wasn’t clear in the first enlargement.
examples.zh: 技术员通过二次放大来检查第一次放大时仍不清楚的细小裂纹。

examples.en: After scanning the photo, the editor applied remagnification to crop and enlarge the subject’s face.
examples.zh: 扫描照片后，编辑对画面进行二次放大，以裁切并放大人物的脸部。

extraExplanation: 该词多见于技术语境：显微镜（microscopy）里可能指把中间图像再次放大；摄影/印刷中则常指对已放大的底片、照片或扫描图进行“再放大”。
日常英语中更常用的表达是 re-enlargement（再次放大）或 further magnification（进一步放大）；remagnification 偏专业、书面。

summary.en: “Remagnified” means “magnified again,” especially in technical contexts like images or microscopy.
summary.zh: “remagnified”意为“再次放大”，常用于图像处理或显微等技术语境。

definition.en: magnified again; made larger a second time (often in imaging, printing, or microscopy).
definition.zh: 再次放大；第二次把图像或物体放大（常见于成像、印刷或显微观察等语境）。

examples.en: The photo was remagnified to show the small details more clearly.
examples.zh: 这张照片被再次放大，以更清楚地显示细小细节。

examples.en: After the first enlargement looked blurry, the technician remagnified the original scan.
examples.zh: 第一次放大看起来很模糊，于是技术员把原始扫描又重新放大了一次。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “remagnify”: to magnify again; to enlarge again.
definition.zh: “remagnify”的过去式/过去分词：再次放大；再次扩大。

examples.en: They remagnified the image and printed a new copy.
examples.zh: 他们把图像重新放大，并打印了一份新副本。

examples.en: The lab remagnified the slide at a higher power for confirmation.
examples.zh: 实验室用更高倍数把载玻片图像再次放大，以进行确认。

extraExplanation: “remagnified”多出现在技术语境（显微镜、摄影后期、扫描/复印、印刷制版等）。它强调“再一次放大”，通常暗示之前已经放大过一次，但需要更大倍率或更清晰的版本。
构词：re-（再一次）+ magnify（放大）→ remagnify；过去式/过去分词为 remagnified。

summary.en: Remagnify means to magnify something again, especially an image.
summary.zh: remagnify 指“再次放大/重新放大”，尤其用于图像等被再度放大。

definition.en: to make something bigger again (for example, to enlarge an image a second time, often after reducing it)
definition.zh: 再次放大；把某物重新放大（例如把缩小过的图像再放大，常见于图像处理）

examples.en: After cropping the photo, the app remagnified the face to fit the frame.
examples.zh: 裁剪照片后，软件把脸部重新放大以适配画面。

examples.en: Scientists remagnified the microscope image to check the details more clearly.
examples.zh: 科学家把显微镜图像再次放大，以更清楚地查看细节。

definition.en: to become bigger again when enlarged a second time (less common)
definition.zh: （较少见）再次变大；被二次放大后变得更大

examples.en: The image remagnified smoothly without losing much clarity.
examples.zh: 图像再次放大得很平滑，清晰度没有损失太多。

extraExplanation: “re-”是英语里表示“再一次/重新”的常见前缀；“magnify”意为“放大”。因此 remagnify 字面意思就是“再次放大”。
这个词在日常口语中不算常见，更常出现在技术语境里（如显微镜观察、图像编辑、数字变焦）。写作中也常用更自然的表达：magnify again / re-enlarge / enlarge again。

summary.en: “Remagnifying” means magnifying something again (re-zooming or re-enlarging), especially in technical contexts.
summary.zh: “remagnifying”指把某物再次放大（重新缩放/重新放大倍率），尤常用于技术语境。

definition.en: to magnify (make something look larger) again, often by adjusting a device such as a microscope, camera, or software zoom
definition.zh: 再次放大（让物体看起来更大），常指通过显微镜、相机或软件缩放等设备重新调整放大倍率

examples.en: The technician is remagnifying the slide to check the cell borders more clearly.
examples.zh: 技术员正在重新放大载玻片，以更清楚地查看细胞边界。

examples.en: After the image was cropped, she started remagnifying the remaining area.
examples.zh: 图像裁剪后，她开始对剩余区域再次放大。

definition.en: (of an image or view) becoming magnified again
definition.zh: （图像或视野）再次被放大、重新放大

examples.en: The view is remagnifying as the autofocus resets.
examples.zh: 自动对焦重置时，画面正在再次放大。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次、重新”。“remagnify / remagnifying”多见于显微镜观察、摄影后期、扫描/打印等较技术性的语境；日常口语更常用“zoom in again / enlarge again”。
拼写提示：magnify（放大）→ magnifying；加上 re- 变为 remagnify → remagnifying。

summary.en: “Remail” means to send mail again, or a service that forwards/re-sends mail to a new address.
summary.zh: “remail”表示“再次寄出（邮件）”，也可指“邮件转寄服务”。

definition.en: to mail something again (for example, after it was returned or sent to the wrong address)
definition.zh: 把某物再次寄出（例如被退回或寄错地址后重新寄）

examples.en: The package was returned to sender, so I remail it with the correct address.
examples.zh: 包裹被退回给寄件人，所以我写上正确地址后重新寄出。

examples.en: If the letter comes back, please remail it to my new apartment.
examples.zh: 如果信被退回，请把它重新寄到我新公寓。

definition.en: a service that forwards (re-sends) your mail to a new address
definition.zh: 邮件转寄服务（把寄到旧地址的信件转寄到新地址）

examples.en: I set up a remail service after I moved.
examples.zh: 我搬家后开通了邮件转寄服务。

examples.en: Ask the post office about remail options.
examples.zh: 可以向邮局咨询邮件转寄的选项。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，这个词常写作 **re-mail**（加连字符）或 **remail**。意思通常和传统邮寄（mail）有关；如果是“重新发送电子邮件”，更常说 **resend the email** 或 **re-email**（较少见）。

summary.en: “Remailed” means “mailed again.”
summary.zh: “remailed”意思是“重新邮寄、再次寄出”。

definition.en: sent (a letter or package) again by mail; mailed something again (often because it was returned, addressed wrongly, or needed to be forwarded).
definition.zh: （信件或包裹）再次寄出；把某物重新邮寄（常因退回、地址错误或需要转寄）。

examples.en: The letter was returned to me, so I remailed it to the correct address.
examples.zh: 信被退回给我，所以我把它重新寄到正确的地址。

examples.en: After fixing the label, she remailed the package the next morning.
examples.zh: 更正标签后，她第二天早上把包裹重新寄出了。

examples.en: The clerk remailed my documents with tracking.
examples.zh: 柜台人员帮我把文件重新寄出，并加了追踪服务。

extraExplanation: “remailed”是动词“remail”的过去式/过去分词。常见于邮政语境，表示“再次寄出、重新邮寄”。有时也用于“转寄”（forward）的情况：原地址收不到，就改寄到新地址。

summary.en: “Remailing” means mailing something again, or forwarding it through another postal system (often for cheaper international postage).
summary.zh: “remailing”指再次寄出，或通过另一国/另一套邮政系统转寄（常用于降低国际邮资）。

definition.en: the act of mailing something again, or forwarding it through another postal system (often to reduce postage costs)
definition.zh: 再次寄出；或通过另一套邮政系统转寄（常用于降低邮资成本）

examples.en: If the package is returned to us, we can fix the address and try remailing it.
examples.zh: 如果包裹被退回，我们可以更正地址再重新寄出。

examples.en: Some companies use remailing to send international letters at a lower rate.
examples.zh: 有些公司会用“转寄/再邮寄”来以更低费率寄国际信件。

definition.en: sending something by mail again; forwarding mail via another country’s postal service
definition.zh: 重新邮寄；通过他国邮政系统转寄邮件

examples.en: We are remailing the documents today with tracking.
examples.zh: 我们今天会把文件重新寄出并提供追踪。

examples.en: The firm was accused of remailing advertising letters to avoid higher domestic postage.
examples.zh: 这家公司被指控通过转寄广告信来规避更高的国内邮资。

extraExplanation: 在邮政/物流语境里，remail（再邮寄/转寄）除了“重新寄一次”，还常指“绕道他国邮政体系寄出”，以利用不同国家的邮资政策。这种做法在合规与否上取决于当地法规与邮政规定。

summary.en: “Remail(s)” means to send something again, or a follow-up mailing (often in marketing).
summary.zh: “remail(s)”指把东西再次寄送/重发；也可指（常见于营销的）跟进寄送。

definition.en: to send something again by mail or email; to mail again
definition.zh: （通过邮寄或电子邮件）再次发送；重寄

examples.en: I’ll remail the package because it was returned to sender.
examples.zh: 我会把包裹重寄一次，因为它被退回给寄件人了。

examples.en: Could you remail the form to me? I didn’t receive the first email.
examples.zh: 你能把表格再发一次给我吗？我没收到第一封邮件。

definition.en: a follow-up mailing, often used in marketing (the second or later mail sent to the same list)
definition.zh: （营销中）二次或多次的跟进邮寄/群发（对同一名单再次寄送）

examples.en: The company scheduled a remail to reach customers who didn’t respond the first time.
examples.zh: 公司安排了二次寄送，以触达第一次没有回复的客户。

examples.en: Response rates often improve after a remail.
examples.zh: 进行跟进寄送后，回复率往往会提高。

extraExplanation: “remails”通常是动词第三人称单数（He remails it. 他会重寄。）或名词复数（two remails 两次跟进寄送）。
在直邮/电邮营销语境里，remail常指“第二波/后续波次”的投放，用来提醒未回应的人；日常口语里更常说 “send it again / resend it”。

summary.en: “Remain” means to stay the same or stay behind; it can also mean what is left (often “remains”).
summary.zh: “remain”表示“仍然/保持不变/留下”，也可表示“剩余部分”（常用“remains”）。

definition.en: to stay in the same place, condition, or situation; to continue to exist or be left
definition.zh: 仍然；保持不变；继续存在；剩下

examples.en: Please remain seated until the plane stops.
examples.zh: 飞机停稳前请保持就座。

examples.en: Only a few questions remain.
examples.zh: 只剩下几个问题。

examples.en: Her name remains unknown.
examples.zh: 她的名字仍然未知。

definition.en: to stay behind after others leave
definition.zh: 留下；逗留（在他人离开后仍不走）

examples.en: After the meeting, she remained to answer questions.
examples.zh: 会议结束后，她留下来回答问题。

examples.en: Most people left, but a few remained.
examples.zh: 大多数人走了，但还有一些人留下了。

definition.en: the part that is left; what is still available or not used (often plural: remains)
definition.zh: 剩余部分；残余（常用复数 remains：遗迹/遗骸）

examples.en: We ate the pizza and saved the remains for lunch.
examples.zh: 我们把披萨吃了，把剩下的留作午餐。

examples.en: They found the remains of an ancient wall.
examples.zh: 他们发现了一段古墙的遗迹。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“remaim”很可能是拼写错误，正确拼写通常是 **remain**。
**remain** 常和介词搭配：remain **in** (留在某处)、remain **on** (继续处于/保持)、remain **to do** (还需要做……)，如：*Much remains to be done.*（还有很多事要做。）

summary.en: “Remain” means to stay, continue, or be left after something happens, often in more formal English than “stay.”
summary.zh: “remain”表示“停留、保持、继续存在或（事后）剩下”，语气通常比“stay”更正式。

definition.en: to stay in the same place or condition; to continue to exist or be left after something happens
definition.zh: 保持不变；继续存在；（在某事发生后）仍然留下/剩下

examples.en: Please remain seated until the train stops.
examples.zh: 火车停稳前请保持就座。

examples.en: Only a few questions remain.
examples.zh: 只剩下几个问题。

examples.en: After the fire, nothing remained of the old house.
examples.zh: 大火之后，那座老房子什么也没留下。

definition.en: to continue to be in a particular state (often used with adjectives like calm, silent, unknown)
definition.zh: 继续处于某种状态（常与 calm/silent/unknown 等形容词连用）

examples.en: She remained calm under pressure.
examples.zh: 她在压力下仍然保持冷静。

examples.en: The cause of the accident remains unknown.
examples.zh: 事故原因仍然不明。

definition.en: to stay behind; not leave with others
definition.zh: 留下；不跟别人一起离开

examples.en: Everyone left, but he remained to help clean up.
examples.zh: 大家都走了，但他留下来帮忙收拾。

extraExplanation: “remain”比“stay”更正式，常见于通知、新闻、报告中：remain seated（请继续坐着）、remain silent（保持沉默）、remains to be seen（尚待观察）。
名词形式“remains”常指“遗迹/遗骸/残留物”，例如: the remains of a temple（寺庙遗址）；human remains（人类遗骸）。注意这是另一个词形用法，但与“remain”意义相关。

summary.en: Remainder means what is left over; in math, it is the leftover amount after division.
summary.zh: remainder表示“剩余部分”；在数学中表示“除法后的余数”。

definition.en: The part that is left over after the main part is used, taken away, or finished.
definition.zh: 剩余部分；余数；剩下的东西（主要部分用完、拿走或完成后留下的部分）。

examples.en: You can keep the remainder of the cake.
examples.zh: 蛋糕剩下的部分你可以留着。

examples.en: We spent most of our budget; the remainder will cover small costs.
examples.zh: 我们的预算大部分都花掉了；剩下的用来支付一些小开销。

definition.en: In math, the amount left after division when one number does not divide evenly into another.
definition.zh: （数学）余数：一个数除以另一个数不能整除时剩下的数。

examples.en: When you divide 17 by 5, the remainder is 2.
examples.zh: 17除以5，余数是2。

examples.en: Check the remainder to see if the division is exact.
examples.zh: 检查余数就能知道除法是否整除。

extraExplanation: “remainder”常用于正式或书面语，表示“剩余部分”。在日常口语里，也常说“the rest”。例如：the remainder of the day（当天剩下的时间）≈ the rest of the day。
数学里常见搭配：remainder after division（除法后的余数）、remainder theorem（余式定理，较偏学术）。

summary.en: “Remaindered” means a book (or similar item) was sold off cheaply because it didn’t sell well at full price.
summary.zh: “remaindered”指（多用于图书）因原价不好卖而被低价清仓处理。

definition.en: (Publishing) Sold off at a very low price because it did not sell well at the original price, often after being removed from normal bookstore distribution.
definition.zh: （出版业）因原价销量不佳而被以低价清仓处理（常指从正常发行渠道撤下后折价出售）。

examples.en: The novel was remaindered after the publisher printed too many copies.
examples.zh: 出版社印得太多，这本小说后来被折价清仓处理了。

examples.en: I found a remaindered cookbook for five dollars at a discount shop.
examples.zh: 我在折扣店花五美元买到一本清仓处理的烹饪书。

examples.en: Some libraries buy remaindered books to save money.
examples.zh: 有些图书馆会购买清仓书以节省经费。

extraExplanation: “remaindered”最常见于图书出版与零售领域，指把滞销库存以远低于原价的方式处理掉。清仓书有时会在书页边缘被盖上或印上“remainder mark”（清仓标记），表示它不再按正常退货/分销规则流通。
不要和数学里的“remainder（余数）”混淆：两者拼写相同，但“remaindered”通常指“被清仓处理（的书）”。

summary.en: Remaindering means clearing unsold books by selling them very cheaply as “remainders.”
summary.zh: remaindering 指将滞销库存书作为“尾货”以很低的价格清仓出售。

definition.en: the practice of selling unsold books (or other goods) at a very low price, often after they are no longer selling well at full price
definition.zh: （尤指出版业中）将卖不动的书以极低价格作为“清仓/尾货”出售的做法（常见于不再以原价畅销之后）

examples.en: The publisher decided to send the leftover copies to remaindering.
examples.zh: 出版社决定把剩余的库存书拿去做清仓尾货处理。

examples.en: Remaindering can make books cheaper for readers, but it may reduce an author's earnings.
examples.zh: 清仓尾货能让读者买到更便宜的书，但可能会减少作者的收入。

definition.en: selling unsold books or goods at a deep discount as “remainders” (present participle of “remainder”)
definition.zh: 把滞销的书或商品作为“尾货”大幅降价出售（动词 remainder 的现在分词）

examples.en: They are remaindering last year's titles to clear space in the warehouse.
examples.zh: 他们正在把去年的书目做尾货处理，以腾出仓库空间。

extraExplanation: 在英语出版业里，remainder（动词）指把卖不掉的库存书打包低价处理；这些书常被称为 “remaindered books / remainders（尾货书/清仓书）”。
“Remaindering” 通常发生在出版社/批发环节（清库存），不同于二手书（used books）或特价促销（sale/discount）——尾货往往是全新的，但价格很低。

summary.en: A remainderman is the person who is legally entitled to receive property after the current owner’s limited interest (like a life estate) ends.
summary.zh: remainderman 指在现有权利（如终身权益）结束后依法取得财产权益的人（余留权人）。

definition.en: In property law, a person who will receive an interest in an estate (especially real property) after the current holder’s interest ends (for example, after a life tenant dies).
definition.zh: （财产法）余留权人：在现有权利人（如终身租赁人/终身享有人）的权益终止后，将取得该不动产或遗产权益的人。

examples.en: After the widow’s life estate ended, her son became the remainderman and took full ownership of the house.
examples.zh: 寡妇的终身权益结束后，她的儿子作为余留权人取得了房屋的完全所有权。

examples.en: The deed names Maria as the life tenant and her daughter as the remainderman.
examples.zh: 契约把玛丽亚列为终身权利人，并把她的女儿列为余留权人。

examples.en: A remainderman may have future rights, but the life tenant controls day-to-day use during the life estate.
examples.zh: 余留权人通常拥有未来权利，但在终身权益期间，日常使用一般由终身权利人控制。

extraExplanation: 这是一个比较正式的法律术语，常见于遗嘱（will）、信托（trust）、不动产契约（deed）等文件中。
与它相关的核心概念是“life estate（终身产权/终身权益）”和“remainder interest（余留权益）”。余留权人通常现在还不能占有或使用财产，但在特定事件发生后（多为终身权利人去世或期限届满）将取得权益。
常见对比：reversion（回归权）指财产在某种权益结束后“回到”原所有人或其继承人；remainder（余留）则是“转给”事先指定的第三方（即 remainderman）。

summary.en: Remaindermen are people who will inherit property later, after someone else’s temporary right (like a life estate) ends.
summary.zh: Remaindermen 指在他人临时权益（如终身产权）结束后，将来取得财产或不动产的人（余留权人，复数）。

definition.en: People who will receive an estate or property in the future after someone else’s temporary right (such as a life estate) ends.
definition.zh: （法律）在他人的临时权益（如终身产权）结束后，将来有权取得不动产或财产的人；余留权人（复数）。

examples.en: Under the will, Maria can live in the house for life, and her children are the remaindermen.
examples.zh: 根据遗嘱，玛丽亚可终身居住在该房屋，她的孩子是余留权人（remaindermen）。

examples.en: The remaindermen may have rights, but they usually cannot take possession until the life tenant dies.
examples.zh: 余留权人可能享有一定权利，但通常要等终身产权人去世后才能实际占有该财产。

definition.en: More generally, people entitled to what is left of a property interest after a prior interest ends.
definition.zh: （更广义）在先前权益终止后，有权取得剩余财产权益的人。

examples.en: The trust names the spouse as the income beneficiary and the grandchildren as remaindermen.
examples.zh: 该信托指定配偶为收益受益人，孙辈为余留权人。

extraExplanation: “Remaindermen”是法律用语，单数是“remainderman”。常见于遗嘱、信托与不动产安排：例如把房子给某人“终身居住/终身享用”（life estate），但房子的最终所有权在其去世后转给remaindermen。
在很多法域，余留权人通常拥有“未来权益”（future interest）：他们可能能阻止浪费性破坏（waste），但在终身产权结束前一般不能占有或自由处分房产。具体权利会因法域与文件条款而不同。

summary.en: Remainders are leftover parts; in math, they are the numbers left after division; in publishing, they can mean unsold items sold cheaply.
summary.zh: remainders指“剩余的部分/剩下的东西”；数学中指“余数”；出版/零售中也可指“滞销品（低价处理）”。

definition.en: Things that are left over after the main part has been used, eaten, or taken away; the rest.
definition.zh: 剩余物；剩下的部分；余下的东西。

examples.en: Put the remainders in the fridge so we can eat them tomorrow.
examples.zh: 把剩菜放进冰箱，这样我们明天还能吃。

examples.en: After the meeting, we cleaned up the remainders of the snacks and drinks.
examples.zh: 会议结束后，我们清理了零食和饮料的剩余。

definition.en: (Math) The amount left after division when one number does not divide evenly into another.
definition.zh: （数学）余数；除法后剩下的数。

examples.en: When you divide 17 by 5, the remainder is 2.
examples.zh: 17除以5，余数是2。

examples.en: Check your work: the remainder should be smaller than the divisor.
examples.zh: 检查一下：余数应该比除数小。

definition.en: (Publishing/retail) Unsold copies of a book or goods sold at a reduced price.
definition.zh: （出版/零售）滞销书/滞销商品（常以低价处理）。

examples.en: The store sold the book as a remainder at a big discount.
examples.zh: 这家店把那本书当作滞销书低价处理。

examples.en: You can sometimes find great deals in the remainders section.
examples.zh: 在特价清仓区你有时能淘到很划算的东西。

extraExplanation: “remainders”是“remainder”的复数。日常生活里更常指“剩下的东西”；数学里常用单数“the remainder”。
出版业里的“remainder”带有行业含义：指库存未售出的书，被出版社/书店以低价清仓处理；有时书上会印“Remainder Mark”（清仓标记）。

summary.en: A rare legal noun meaning the status or right of being entitled to receive property later as a “remainder.”
summary.zh: 较少见的法律名词，指作为“余留权益人”将来取得财产/遗产的地位或权利。

definition.en: the legal status or right of being the person who will receive property or an estate after someone else’s interest ends (a “remainder” in property law)
definition.zh: （法律）“余留权益”人的身份或权利：当他人的占有/使用权终止后，依法将获得财产或遗产的权利或地位

examples.en: Under the trust, her son holds the remaindership and will receive the house after her death.
examples.zh: 根据该信托安排，她的儿子拥有余留权益，在她去世后将获得这套房子。

examples.en: The dispute centered on whether his remaindership could be transferred to another heir.
examples.zh: 争议焦点在于他的余留权益身份是否可以转让给另一位继承人。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见、偏法律用语的词，多见于不动产法（property law）、遗嘱与信托（wills and trusts）语境。常见基础词是 remainder（余留权益）与 remainderman（享有余留权益的人）。remaindership 用来强调“作为余留权益人的地位/资格/权利”，而不是具体的那份财产本身。
相关概念对比：life estate（终身产权/终身使用权）指某人可在其生前使用该财产；remainder / remaindership 则指终身权利结束后由谁取得该财产的安排。

summary.en: “Remaindment” is not a standard word; you likely mean “remainder” (what is left over; in math, the leftover after division).
summary.zh: “remaindment”不是标准单词；你很可能想写“remainder”（剩余部分；数学中的余数）。

definition.en: (Commonly intended when someone writes “remaindment”) the part that is left over; what remains after the main part is used, taken, or considered.
definition.zh: （“remaindment”常见的想写法）剩余部分；余下的东西。

examples.en: You can eat the remainder of the cake tomorrow.
examples.zh: 蛋糕剩下的部分你可以明天再吃。

examples.en: After paying rent, the remainder of my money goes to food and transport.
examples.zh: 付完房租后，我剩下的钱用来吃饭和交通。

definition.en: (Math) the number left after division when the result is not exact.
definition.zh: （数学）余数；除不尽时剩下的数。

examples.en: 10 divided by 3 is 3 with a remainder of 1.
examples.zh: 10除以3等于3，余数是1。

examples.en: Find the remainder when 25 is divided by 4.
examples.zh: 求25除以4的余数。

extraExplanation: “remaindment”不是标准英语拼写。最常见的正确词是 **remainder**（剩余；余数）。
如果你本来想表达“提醒”的意思，通常用 **reminder**（提醒物/提示）或动词 **remind**（提醒）。
如果你是在法律语境里想说“发回重审/还押”，正确词一般是 **remand**（而不是 *remandment*）。

summary.en: Remainder means what is left over (including the rest of time), and in math it means the leftover after division.
summary.zh: Remainder 指“剩余部分/余下时间”，在数学中指“余数”。

definition.en: the part that is left over after the main part has been used, taken, or dealt with; what remains
definition.zh: 剩余部分；余数；剩下的东西

examples.en: I ate two slices of pizza and saved the remainder for dinner.
examples.zh: 我吃了两片披萨，把剩下的留到晚餐。

examples.en: After paying the rent, the remainder of my money goes to food and bills.
examples.zh: 付完房租后，我剩下的钱用来买吃的和支付账单。

definition.en: (math) the amount left over after division that cannot be evenly divided
definition.zh: （数学）余数

examples.en: When you divide 17 by 5, the remainder is 2.
examples.zh: 17除以5，余数是2。

examples.en: Check your work: the remainder should be less than the divisor.
examples.zh: 检查一下：余数应该小于除数。

definition.en: the rest of a period of time; the remaining time
definition.zh: （时间）剩余时间；余下的时段

examples.en: We stayed quiet for the remainder of the meeting.
examples.zh: 在会议剩余时间里我们保持安静。

examples.en: For the remainder of the week, I’ll be working from home.
examples.zh: 这周剩下的时间我会在家办公。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“remaindre”很可能是拼写错误，正确拼法通常是 **remainder**。常见搭配有：**the remainder of + 名词**（……的其余部分/剩余时间），以及数学里的 **remainder**（余数）。

summary.en: “Remained” means “stayed,” “continued to be,” or “was left over” (past tense of remain).
summary.zh: “remained”是“remain”的过去式/过去分词，表示“留下/停留”“仍然保持某状态”或“剩下”。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “remain”: stayed in the same place; did not leave.
definition.zh: “remain”的过去式/过去分词：留在原地；没有离开。

examples.en: She remained in her seat until the meeting ended.
examples.zh: 会议结束前，她一直留在座位上。

examples.en: Please stay here; the doctor will be with you soon.
examples.zh: 请留在这里；医生很快就来。

definition.en: Continued to be in the same state or condition; stayed the same.
definition.zh: 保持某种状态；仍然是（没有改变）。

examples.en: He remained calm during the emergency.
examples.zh: 在紧急情况下，他仍然很冷静。

examples.en: The facts remained unclear.
examples.zh: 事实仍然不清楚。

definition.en: Was still left after others were used, taken, or went away; was the leftover part.
definition.zh: 剩下；余留（在被使用/拿走/离开之后仍存在）。

examples.en: Only a few cookies remained after the party.
examples.zh: 派对结束后只剩下几块饼干。

examples.en: After the fire, little remained of the old house.
examples.zh: 大火过后，老房子所剩无几。

extraExplanation: “remained”是“remain”的过去式/过去分词。常见结构有：remain + adj.（保持……），remain + n.（仍是/仍为……），remain + to do（还有……要做）。
口语里如果强调“仍然”，也常用“still”来加强语气：He remained silent. = He still remained silent（后者更强调）。

summary.en: “Remain” means to stay, continue, or be left over.
summary.zh: “remain”表示“停留/保持/继续存在”，也可指“剩下”。

definition.en: to continue to exist or stay in the same place or condition; to be left after others have gone or been used
definition.zh: 继续存在；停留在原处或保持原状；（在其他人离开或用完后）剩下

examples.en: Please remain seated until the plane comes to a full stop.
examples.zh: 飞机完全停稳之前请保持就座。

examples.en: After the fire, only the walls remained.
examples.zh: 火灾过后，只剩下墙壁。

examples.en: Two questions remain unanswered.
examples.zh: 还有两个问题没有得到回答。

definition.en: to stay as a member of a group or organization
definition.zh: （作为成员）继续留下/留任

examples.en: She decided to remain with the company for another year.
examples.zh: 她决定再在这家公司留一年。

examples.en: He remained on the team despite the injury.
examples.zh: 尽管受伤，他仍留在队里。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“remainen”不是标准拼写。最可能想写的是 **remain**（动词：留下/保持/剩下）或 **remaining**（形容词：剩下的）。如果你想查的是“remaining”，我也可以给你对应词条。

summary.en: “Remainer” is uncommon as “what remains”; modern English usually uses “remainder” for the leftover part, and “remainer” for a person who stays.
summary.zh: “remainer”用来表示“剩余部分”并不常见；现代英语通常用“remainder”指剩余部分，用“remainer”指留下来的人。

definition.en: A less common spelling/word meaning “a person or thing that remains,” but in modern English this is usually written as “remainder” (for what is left) or “remainer” (for a person who stays).
definition.zh: 较少见的拼写/用法，可表示“留下来的人或事物”；但现代英语中通常写作“remainder”（剩余的部分）或“remainer”（留下来的人）。

examples.en: In older texts, you may see “remainer” used where modern English would prefer “remainder.”
examples.zh: 在较旧的文本中，你可能会看到“remainer”，而现代英语更常用“remainder”。

examples.en: After the guests left, the remainder of the cake stayed on the table.
examples.zh: 客人走后，蛋糕的剩余部分还留在桌上。

extraExplanation: “remainer”很可能是把“remainder（剩余部分）”拼错了：remainder常用于日常与数学（例如“余数”）。
如果你想表达“留在原地/继续留下的人”，现代英语更常用“remainer”（常见于政治语境，如英国脱欧讨论中指“留欧派”）。
词源上两者都来自“remain（留下）”，但当表示“剩下的部分”时，标准形式是“remainder”。

summary.en: “Remaining” usually means “still left” (adjective) or “the part that is left” (noun). It’s related to the verb “remain,” meaning “continue to stay or be.”
summary.zh: remaining通常表示“剩下的”（形容词）或“剩余部分”（名词）；它来源于动词remain，意为“仍然；继续保持；留下”。

definition.en: still left; not yet used, finished, or dealt with.
definition.zh: 剩下的；尚未使用、完成或处理的。

examples.en: How much time is remaining?
examples.zh: 还剩多少时间？

examples.en: Only two tickets are remaining.
examples.zh: 只剩下两张票了。

examples.en: Please finish the remaining tasks by Friday.
examples.zh: 请在周五前完成剩下的任务。

definition.en: the part that is left after the rest has been used, eaten, or taken away.
definition.zh: 剩余部分；剩下的东西。

examples.en: We packed up the remaining food.
examples.zh: 我们把剩下的食物打包了。

examples.en: The remaining of the budget will go to training.
examples.zh: 预算的剩余部分将用于培训。

definition.en: continuing to stay in the same place, condition, or situation.
definition.zh: 继续留下；仍然处于同一地点、状态或情况。

examples.en: She remained calm during the interview.
examples.zh: 她在面试中仍然很冷静。

examples.en: After the meeting, a few people remained to talk.
examples.zh: 会议结束后，还有几个人留下来聊天。

extraExplanation:
“remaining”常见于两种语法：
1) 作形容词：remaining time/money/students（剩余的……）。
2) 作现在分词：the remaining students（= the students who remain）。
注意与“left”的区别：两者都表示“剩下的”，但“remaining”更正式，常用于书面语或公告；“left”更口语、更常用。

summary.en: “Remains” can mean leftovers/ruins (including human remains), or it can be the verb form meaning “continues to be” or “is still left.”
summary.zh: remains既可作名词表示“残余/遗迹/遗骸”，也可作动词remain的第三人称单数，表示“仍然/继续/剩下”。

definition.en: what is left after the main part is gone; the leftover parts of something
definition.zh: 剩余物；残余部分

examples.en: Only the remains of the old castle are still standing.
examples.zh: 那座古堡只剩下遗迹还立着。

examples.en: Please throw the food remains into the trash.
examples.zh: 请把食物残渣丢进垃圾桶。

examples.en: They found human remains near the river.
examples.zh: 他们在河边发现了人体遗骸。

definition.en: the body of a dead person; a corpse (often used in news, police, or formal writing)
definition.zh: 遗体；尸体（多用于新闻、警方或正式语体）

examples.en: The remains were identified by DNA testing.
examples.zh: 通过DNA检测确认了遗体身份。

examples.en: The family asked to bring the remains home for burial.
examples.zh: 家属请求把遗体带回家安葬。

definition.en: stays in the same place or state; continues to be (third-person singular of “remain”)
definition.zh: 仍然；保持不变；继续（动词 remain 的第三人称单数）

examples.en: He remains calm under pressure.
examples.zh: 他在压力下仍然冷静。

examples.en: Only one question remains.
examples.zh: 只剩下一个问题。

examples.en: The store remains open until 9 p.m.
examples.zh: 这家店一直营业到晚上九点。

extraExplanation: “remains”既可以是名词复数（表示“残余/遗骸”），也可以是动词“remain”的第三人称单数（表示“仍然/继续/剩下”）。判断方法：如果前面常接the/these/those，多半是名词；如果后面接形容词或地点/状态（calm, open, here），多半是动词。
在“human remains”里，remains几乎固定指“遗骸/遗体”，语气比“dead body”更正式、更常见于报道或法医语境。

summary.en: Maintain means to keep something in good condition, to keep a level or situation continuing, or to state firmly that something is true.
summary.zh: Maintain 指维护保养、维持保持，或在有争议时坚称某事为真。

definition.en: to keep something in a good condition by checking or repairing it regularly
definition.zh: （通过定期检查或修理）维护、保养，使保持良好状态

examples.en: It’s important to maintain your car so it stays safe to drive.
examples.zh: 定期保养你的车很重要，这样开起来才安全。

examples.en: The building is old, but it’s well maintained.
examples.zh: 这栋楼很老，但维护得很好。

definition.en: to continue to have or keep a certain level, standard, or situation
definition.zh: 保持（水平、标准或状态）；维持

examples.en: She maintains a healthy lifestyle.
examples.zh: 她保持健康的生活方式。

examples.en: The company tried to maintain high quality.
examples.zh: 公司努力维持高质量标准。

definition.en: to say firmly that something is true, even when others disagree
definition.zh: 坚称；坚持认为（即使别人不同意）

examples.en: He maintained that he had done nothing wrong.
examples.zh: 他坚称自己没有做错任何事。

examples.en: She maintains it was an accident.
examples.zh: 她坚持说那是个意外。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“remaintain”不是常见英文单词，最可能是把 maintain（维护/维持/坚称）和 remain（仍然是/保持不变）混在一起了。
小对比：remain 多用于“状态继续存在”（e.g., "Please remain calm." 请保持冷静）；maintain 多用于“努力保持/维护某事”（e.g., "maintain order" 维持秩序，"maintain a machine" 维护机器）。

summary.en: Remaintenance means doing maintenance again—renewed upkeep or repair after prior maintenance.
summary.zh: Remaintenance 指“再次维护/重新保养”，强调在已维护后又进行新一轮的维护或检修。

definition.en: maintenance done again, or a renewed period of upkeep and repair after something has already been maintained.
definition.zh: 再次维护；在已经维护过之后进行的重新保养、检修与修复。

examples.en: After the first service, the machine needed remaintenance within six months.
examples.zh: 第一次保养后，这台机器在六个月内又需要再次维护。

examples.en: The contract includes remaintenance if the same issue returns.
examples.zh: 合同包含“问题复发时的再次维护”。

extraExplanation: “remaintenance”在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的表达是“follow-up maintenance（后续维护）”“repeat maintenance（重复维护）”“maintenance again（再次维护）”或更具体的“rework/repair（返工/维修）”。
在工程、设备管理、合同条款中偶尔会看到它，用来强调“第二次（或之后）进行的维护”这一概念。

summary.en: Remake means to make something again or to create a new version (especially of a movie or game).
summary.zh: Remake 指重做某物，或（尤指电影/游戏等）制作一个新的版本（翻拍/重制）。

definition.en: to make something again or differently; to create a new version of something
definition.zh: 重做；重新制作；改做（做出不同版本）

examples.en: If this cake tastes salty, I’ll remake it from scratch.
examples.zh: 如果这蛋糕尝起来咸，我会从头重做。

examples.en: They remade the website to make it faster and easier to use.
examples.zh: 他们重新制作了网站，让它更快、更好用。

definition.en: a new version of a movie, song, game, or other work based on an earlier one
definition.zh: （电影/歌曲/游戏等的）翻拍版；重制版

examples.en: The remake stays close to the original story but updates the setting.
examples.zh: 这部翻拍版基本忠于原故事，但把背景设定更新了。

examples.en: Some fans prefer the original to the remake.
examples.zh: 有些粉丝更喜欢原版而不是翻拍版。

extraExplanation: 在影视语境里，remake 常译为“翻拍”，强调用新演员/新制作重新讲同一个故事；在游戏语境里也常指“重制版”。常与 reboot（重启：重开一个系列设定或时间线）对比：remake 更像“同故事再拍/再做”，reboot 更像“重新开始一个版本”。

summary.en: A remaker is someone who makes a new version of something, especially by remaking a film, song, or product.
summary.zh: remaker 指重新制作新版本的人或机构，尤指翻拍电影、改编歌曲或再做产品。

definition.en: a person or company that makes something again, or produces a new version of something (especially a movie, song, or product)
definition.zh: 重新制作某物的人或公司；（尤指电影、歌曲或产品的）翻拍者／再制作方

examples.en: The remaker kept the original story but updated the setting for modern audiences.
examples.zh: 翻拍者保留了原本的故事，但把背景更新成更符合现代观众。

examples.en: As a remaker of classic films, the studio faces high expectations from fans.
examples.zh: 作为经典电影的翻拍方，这家制片厂面临影迷很高的期待。

extraExplanation: “remaker”= remake（重新制作/翻拍）+ -er（表示“做某事的人/物”的后缀）。在日常英语里更常见的说法是用动词或名词短语：to remake something（重新制作某物）、a remake studio/producer（翻拍工作室/制片人）。单独用“remaker”相对少见，但意思清楚、可理解。

summary.en: “Remakes” can mean “makes again” (verb) or “new versions of old works, especially films” (noun plural).
summary.zh: “Remakes”既可作动词表示“重做/重新制作”，也可作名词复数表示“（尤指电影等的）翻拍版/再制作版本”。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular of “remake”) to make something again or differently, often to improve it or replace an older version.
definition.zh: （动词，remake 的第三人称单数）重新制作；重做（常为改进或替换旧版本）。

examples.en: She remakes the dress using new fabric.
examples.zh: 她用新布料把那条裙子重新做了一遍。

examples.en: The company remakes the app every year to fix bugs and add features.
examples.zh: 这家公司每年都会重做一次应用来修复漏洞并增加功能。

definition.en: (noun, plural of “remake”) new versions of older creative works, especially films or TV shows.
definition.zh: （名词，remake 的复数）对旧作品的再创作版本，尤指电影或电视剧的翻拍版。

examples.en: Some remakes are better than the originals.
examples.zh: 有些翻拍版比原作更好。

examples.en: Hollywood releases many remakes of popular movies.
examples.zh: 好莱坞推出了许多热门电影的翻拍版。

extraExplanation: 在影视语境里，remake（翻拍）通常指“用同一个核心故事重新拍一遍”，可能更新演员、画面和细节，但主线相近。reboot（重启）更强调“把系列重新开始”，设定和故事线可能变化更大。

summary.en: Remaking means making something again or creating a new version, often used for films, products, or personal changes.
summary.zh: Remaking 指“重做、重新制作或重塑”，常用于电影翻拍、产品改版或生活习惯的重建。

definition.en: the act or process of making something again or in a new form
definition.zh: 重做；重新制作（某物）的过程

examples.en: The remaking of the website took three months.
examples.zh: 网站的重新制作花了三个月。

examples.en: She is focused on the remaking of her daily routine.
examples.zh: 她专注于重建自己的日常作息。

definition.en: making something again; creating a new version of something (often a movie, song, or product)
definition.zh: 重拍；翻新；再做一次（常指电影、歌曲或产品做出新版本）

examples.en: They’re remaking the classic film for a younger audience.
examples.zh: 他们正在为更年轻的观众重拍这部经典电影。

examples.en: The company is remaking its logo to look more modern.
examples.zh: 公司正在重新设计标志，让它看起来更现代。

definition.en: being made again or changed into a new version
definition.zh: 正在被重新制作的；正在被改造成新版本的

examples.en: The remaking process changed the story a lot.
examples.zh: 重拍过程让故事改动很大。

extraExplanation: “remaking”常出现在影视语境：remake（重拍/翻拍）指用新的演员、技术或叙事方式再拍一遍同一题材。英语里也常用“a remake of + 作品名”表示“……的重拍版/翻拍版”。
日常写作中，“remaking”作名词时更偏抽象（如习惯、生活、制度的“重塑/重建”）；如果你想表达“制作一个新版本”，也可以用更常见的名词“remake”（例如：a remake of the movie）。

summary.en: “Reman” is an industry short form for “remanufactured,” meaning rebuilt to work like new.
summary.zh: “Reman”是“remanufactured（再制造）”的行业缩写，指按接近新品标准重建的产品/零件。

definition.en: a remanufactured product or part (made again from used parts so it works like new), especially in the auto and machinery industries
definition.zh: 再制造产品；再制造零件（把旧件回收后修复/更换关键部件，使其性能接近新品），常见于汽车与机械行业

examples.en: I bought a reman engine to save money, and it runs well.
examples.zh: 我买了一台再制造发动机来省钱，运行得很好。

examples.en: The shop can install a reman alternator today.
examples.zh: 修理店今天就能安装一个再制造发电机。

definition.en: remanufactured; rebuilt to meet performance standards similar to a new item
definition.zh: 再制造的；翻新的（按接近新品的标准重建）

examples.en: This printer comes with a reman toner cartridge.
examples.zh: 这台打印机配的是再制造的墨粉盒。

examples.en: Ask whether the part is new, used, or reman.
examples.zh: 问清楚这个零件是新的、二手的，还是再制造的。

extraExplanation: “reman”多见于口语、标签或行业文件，是“remanufactured / remanufacturing”的缩写，尤其常见于汽车零件（reman engine/alternator/starter等）。
与“used（二手）”不同，reman通常经历检测、清洁、修复/更换磨损件并重新测试；与“refurbished（翻新）”相比，reman往往更强调按规格重建并通过更严格的测试。购买时可留意是否有“core charge（旧件回收押金）”与保修条款。

summary.en: Remanage means to manage something again, usually with changes to how it’s organized or run.
summary.zh: Remanage 指对某事物进行再次/重新管理，通常伴随组织或运作方式的调整。

definition.en: to manage something again, often by reorganizing or changing how it is run
definition.zh: 重新管理（某事物），通常指通过重组或改变运作方式来管理

examples.en: After the merger, the company had to remanage several teams.
examples.zh: 合并之后，公司不得不重新管理好几个团队。

examples.en: We remanaged the schedule to reduce overtime.
examples.zh: 我们重新调整并管理了排班，以减少加班。

extraExplanation: “remanage”由前缀 re-（表示“再一次/重新”）+ manage 组成，语义直观，但在日常英语里不算常用；商务写作中更常见替代表达如 “reorganize（重组）”、“restructure（重整）”、“manage again（再管理一次）” 或 “revamp management（改造管理方式）”。
当你想强调“改变管理方式/重新分配职责”时，用 “restructure” 或 “reorganize” 往往更自然；“remanage”更偏“再次接手管理/重新进行管理”。

summary.en: Remanagement means managing something again or reorganizing management to improve performance.
summary.zh: Remanagement 指“再次管理/重新管理”，也可指“管理层或管理体系的重组”，通常为了改进表现。

definition.en: the act or process of managing something again, often to improve results or fix problems (a second round of management)
definition.zh: 再次管理；重新进行管理的过程，常指为改进结果或解决问题而进行的第二轮管理

examples.en: After the crisis, the company began a full remanagement of its finances.
examples.zh: 危机之后，公司开始对财务进行全面的重新管理。

examples.en: The project’s remanagement focused on clearer roles and better communication.
examples.zh: 该项目的重新管理重点是更清晰的分工和更好的沟通。

definition.en: a change or restructuring of a management team or management system
definition.zh: 管理层/管理体系的调整或重组

examples.en: The board announced a remanagement of the leadership team.
examples.zh: 董事会宣布对领导团队进行调整。

examples.en: Remanagement helped the department run more efficiently.
examples.zh: 管理重组帮助该部门更高效地运作。

extraExplanation: “remanagement”不是非常常见的标准词汇，更常见的说法包括：reorganization（重组）、restructuring（重构/重组）、management overhaul（管理大改造）、new management（新管理层）。不过在商业写作或内部文件中，有时会用它来强调“再管理一次/重新接管并改进”。
构词上：re-（再次）+ management（管理）。重音通常落在“man”所在的音节上。

summary.en: Remanation means a renewed or repeated emanation—something flowing out or appearing again from a source.
summary.zh: Remanation 指“再度发散/再度流出/再度显现”的过程或现象。

definition.en: the act or process of emanating (flowing out, spreading, or being produced) again; a renewed outflow or reappearance of something that once came from a source
definition.zh: 再次发出／再次散发（向外流出、传播或产生）的过程；某物从源头重新外溢或再度出现

examples.en: In the poem, the morning light feels like a remanation of yesterday’s hope.
examples.zh: 在这首诗里，清晨的光像是昨日希望的再度散发。

examples.en: Some writers describe memory as a remanation of past experience.
examples.zh: 有些作者把记忆形容为过去经历的再度流出／再度显现。

extraExplanation: “remanation”是非常少见、偏文学或哲学语境的词，结构上是 re-（再、重新）+ emanation（发散、流出）。日常英语里更常用 re-emergence（再现）、return（回归）、renewed spread（再次扩散）、renewed emission（再次释放/排放）等表达。
在宗教/哲学写作中，它有时用于描述“从某个本源再次流出或显现”的观念，带一点抽象、隐喻色彩。

summary.en: “Remancipate” means to emancipate someone again (a rare word; usually written “reemancipate” or just “emancipate”).
summary.zh: “remancipate”意为“再次解放/再次恢复自由或独立”（很少见；更常写作“reemancipate”，或直接用“emancipate”）。

definition.en: to emancipate (set free) again; to restore someone’s freedom or legal independence after it was taken away
definition.zh: 再次解放；在自由或法律独立被剥夺后，再度恢复其自由或独立地位

examples.en: After the unfair policy was repealed, the government re-emancipated the workers and returned their rights.
examples.zh: 不公平的政策被废除后，政府再次解放了工人，并归还了他们的权利。

examples.en: The court’s decision effectively re-emancipated him, allowing him to make his own legal choices again.
examples.zh: 法院的裁决等于让他再次获得法律上的独立，使他可以重新自己做法律决定。

extraExplanation: “remancipate”非常少见，很多情况下是拼写或造词上的变体；更常见、也更标准的写法是“reemancipate”（re- + emancipate），或直接用常用词“emancipate”（解放；给予独立）。
“emancipate”在英语里常与历史语境有关，例如“the emancipation of enslaved people”（对被奴役者的解放）。在现代语境中也可用于“emancipate yourself from…”（让自己摆脱某种束缚），但“remancipate/reemancipate”通常只在强调“再次恢复自由/权利”时才会出现。

summary.en: “Remancipation” is not standard; you probably mean “emancipation,” meaning being set free from slavery, control, or restrictions.
summary.zh: “remancipation”不是标准用法；你可能想写“emancipation”，意思是从奴役、控制或限制中获得解放/自由。

definition.en: (Likely intended word) Emancipation: the act of freeing someone from slavery, control, or legal restrictions; the state of being free.
definition.zh: （很可能是你想写的词）emancipation：解放；从奴役、控制或法律限制中获得自由的行为或状态。

examples.en: The Emancipation Proclamation was an important step toward ending slavery in the United States.
examples.zh: 《解放奴隶宣言》是美国走向结束奴隶制的重要一步。

examples.en: For her, financial independence meant emancipation from relying on her family.
examples.zh: 对她来说，经济独立意味着不再依赖家人的解放。

examples.en: The new law supported the emancipation of young adults from strict guardianship rules.
examples.zh: 新法律支持年轻人从严格的监护规定中获得解放。

extraExplanation: “remancipation”不是常见或标准拼写，通常会被认为是拼写错误。最接近、最常用的词是“emancipation”。
词根提示：emancipation 来自拉丁语，e-/ex- 表示“出去、脱离”，manus 表示“手”（引申为“控制”），整体含义是“从他人之手/控制中被释放”。
常见搭配：emancipation from（从……中解放出来）；women’s emancipation（妇女解放）；the emancipation of slaves（奴隶解放）。

summary.en: Remand means to send a case back to a lower court, or to keep/return someone to custody while awaiting trial.
summary.zh: Remand 指将案件发回下级法院，或将某人还押/候审羁押。

definition.en: (Law) To send a case or a person back to a lower court, or to keep a person in custody while waiting for trial or further decisions.
definition.zh: （法律）将案件发回下级法院重审；或在等待审判/进一步决定期间将某人还押（羁押）。

examples.en: The appeals court remanded the case to the trial court for a new hearing.
examples.zh: 上诉法院将该案件发回初审法院重新开庭审理。

examples.en: The judge remanded him in custody until the next court date.
examples.zh: 法官裁定将他还押至下次开庭。

definition.en: (Law, chiefly UK) The act or period of being kept in custody while awaiting trial; a return to custody.
definition.zh: （法律，主要英式）候审羁押；还押期间。

examples.en: He was held on remand for two weeks.
examples.zh: 他被候审羁押了两周。

examples.en: She was denied bail and placed on remand.
examples.zh: 她被拒绝保释并被还押候审。

extraExplanation: “remand”在法律英语里很常见：作动词时常见搭配是 remand a case to…（把案件发回……），以及 remand someone in custody / on remand（把某人还押/令其候审羁押）。
英美用法有差异：在英国新闻中 “on remand” 特别常见，指尚未定罪、但因保释被拒而被关押等待审理；在美国也用，但更常见于正式法律语境。注意它不同于 “parole”（假释）或 “probation”（缓刑）。
词源上来自法语/拉丁语，核心含义是“送回、交回”，所以既能指“把案件送回下级法院”，也能指“把人送回看守所/羁押”。

summary.en: Remanded means “sent back,” especially in law: a case is sent back to a lower court, or a person is kept in custody while awaiting further proceedings.
summary.zh: Remanded 意为“发回/送回”，尤其用于法律语境：可指案件被发回下级法院继续处理，也可指某人被法院决定羁押候审。

definition.en: (Legal) Sent a case back to a lower court or agency for further action or a new decision.
definition.zh: （法律）将案件发回下级法院或相关机构，要求进一步处理或重新裁定。

examples.en: The appeals court remanded the case for a new trial.
examples.zh: 上诉法院将该案发回重审。

examples.en: The judge remanded the dispute to the agency for review.
examples.zh: 法官将该争议发回给相关机构复核。

definition.en: (Legal, custody) Ordered someone to be kept in custody, usually in jail, while waiting for trial or another hearing.
definition.zh: （法律，羁押）下令将某人收押（通常在监狱或看守所），等待审判或进一步听证。

examples.en: He was remanded in custody until the next hearing.
examples.zh: 他被羁押至下次听证。

examples.en: The suspect was remanded to jail after the bail request was denied.
examples.zh: 嫌疑人在保释申请被拒后被收押入狱。

definition.en: Sent back or returned for correction, revision, or reconsideration.
definition.zh: 退回、发回以便修改、更正或重新考虑。

examples.en: The report was remanded to the team for corrections.
examples.zh: 报告被退回团队进行更正。

examples.en: The application was remanded because key documents were missing.
examples.zh: 由于缺少关键文件，该申请被退回。

extraExplanation: “remand”在法律英语里非常常见，分两条主线：①案件层面：上级法院把案件“发回（remand）”下级法院或行政机关继续处理；②人身层面：法院决定被告“羁押候审（remand in custody）”。两者语境不同，但核心都是“送回去/交回去继续处理”。
英美新闻里常见搭配：“remanded for further proceedings”（发回进一步审理）、“remanded for resentencing”（发回重新量刑）、“remanded in custody”（羁押）。

summary.en: Remanding means sending someone back into custody or sending a legal case back for further action; it can also mean sending something back.
summary.zh: remanding 指（法律）将人还押或将案件发回进一步处理；也可指把某物退回。

definition.en: In law, sending a person back into custody (e.g., to jail) to wait for a trial or a court decision.
definition.zh: （法律）将某人还押（如送回看守所/监狱）以等待审判或法院决定。

examples.en: The judge is remanding the suspect in custody until the next hearing.
examples.zh: 法官决定将嫌疑人还押，直到下一次开庭。

examples.en: After the brief hearing, the court kept remanding him to jail.
examples.zh: 在简短的听证后，法院仍将他还押入狱。

definition.en: Sending a case back to a lower court or an earlier stage for a new decision or more work.
definition.zh: （法律）将案件发回下级法院或前一程序重新审理/补充处理。

examples.en: The appeals court is remanding the case for a new trial.
examples.zh: 上诉法院将案件发回重审。

examples.en: They are remanding the decision because key evidence was not considered.
examples.zh: 由于关键证据未被考虑，他们将该裁决发回重新处理。

definition.en: Sending something back, especially to the person or place it came from.
definition.zh: （较少见）把某物退回/送回原处。

examples.en: She is remanding the faulty device to the supplier for replacement.
examples.zh: 她正把有故障的设备退回供应商更换。

extraExplanation: “remanding”来自动词 remand（还押/发回），在新闻与法庭语境中很常见：remand someone in custody（将某人还押）与 remand a case（将案件发回）是两种核心搭配。
英美法律新闻里常见对比：grant bail（准予保释） vs. remand in custody（不准保释而还押）。

summary.en: A rare noun meaning the act of remanding (sending back to custody or returning a case to a lower court).
summary.zh: 一个罕见名词，指“还押/羁押”或“发回下级法院处理”的行为。

definition.en: (Rare) the act of remanding someone or something; sending a person back into custody or sending a case back to a lower court for further action.
definition.zh: （罕用）“remand”的名词形式：将某人还押/羁押，或把案件发回下级法院继续处理的行为。

examples.en: The judge ordered a remandment, and the defendant was taken back into custody.
examples.zh: 法官下令还押，被告被带回羁押。

examples.en: The appeal resulted in a remandment to the trial court for more evidence.
examples.zh: 上诉导致案件被发回一审法院以补充证据。

extraExplanation: “Remandment”在现代英语里非常少见，法律语境中更常用的是“remand”（名词/动词同形）。写作或正式文件里一般建议用“a remand”或“the case was remanded”。
法律里“remand”常见两种方向：①刑事案件中把被告“还押/继续羁押”（remand in custody / on remand）；②上级法院把案件“发回重审/发回处理”（remand to the lower court）。

summary.en: “Remands” usually means a judge sends someone back into custody or a higher court sends a case back for further action; it can also mean the plural noun “remand cases/people.”
summary.zh: “Remands”通常指法官裁定还押或上级法院将案件发回进一步处理；也可作复数名词，指多起发回案件/还押情况。

definition.en: (third-person singular of remand) to send someone back into custody or return a case to a lower court for further action.
definition.zh: （remand 的第三人称单数）将某人还押/羁押；或将案件发回下级法院进一步处理。

examples.en: The judge remands the defendant to custody until the next hearing.
examples.zh: 法官裁定被告还押，等待下一次听证。

examples.en: The appeals court remands the case for a new trial.
examples.zh: 上诉法院将案件发回重审。

definition.en: (plural noun) cases or people that are sent back, especially in legal or immigration contexts.
definition.zh: （复数名词）被发回处理的案件；或（尤指法律/移民语境中）被还押、被发回的人/情况。

examples.en: The prison reported a rise in remands this month.
examples.zh: 监狱报告称本月还押人数上升。

examples.en: The court listed several remands for further investigation.
examples.zh: 法院列出了数起发回以便进一步调查的案件。

extraExplanation:
“remand”在英美新闻与法律英语里很常见：
- remand someone in custody = 裁定某人继续羁押（未定罪也可能被羁押，等待审理）
- remand a case = 上级法院把案件“发回”让下级法院补充审理/重新审理
注意它不同于“sentence”（宣判、判刑）：remand 不等于已被定罪。

summary.en: Remanence means what remains—especially residual magnetism left after a magnetic field is removed, or more generally a lingering trace or effect.
summary.zh: Remanence 指“残留/仍存之物”，尤其指外加磁场移除后材料中的剩磁；也可泛指某事结束后仍留下的痕迹或影响。

definition.en: (Physics) The magnetization that remains in a material after an external magnetic field is removed; residual magnetism.
definition.zh: （物理）外加磁场移除后材料中仍然保留的磁化强度；剩磁。

examples.en: The technician measured the remanence of the steel after the magnet was taken away.
examples.zh: 技术员在移开磁铁后测量了钢材的剩磁（remanence）。

examples.en: High remanence is useful in making permanent magnets.
examples.zh: 较高的剩磁有助于制造永磁体。

definition.en: A lingering trace or effect that remains after something has ended (a more general, less technical use).
definition.zh: （较通用）某事结束后仍然留下的痕迹或影响。

examples.en: There was a remanence of fear in the room even after the argument ended.
examples.zh: 即使争吵结束后，房间里仍残留着一丝恐惧的气氛。

examples.en: The photo carries a remanence of summer light.
examples.zh: 这张照片保留着夏日光线的余韵。

extraExplanation: 词源来自拉丁语 remanere（re- “再次/向后” + manere “停留”），核心含义是“留下来、仍然存在”。
在磁学里，remanence 常和 hysteresis（磁滞）曲线一起出现；材料退磁到外场为零时仍保留的磁化量就是 remanence。相关词：remanent（形容词，表示“剩余的/残留的”）。

summary.en: Remanency mainly means the magnetism that remains in a material after the external magnetic field is removed.
summary.zh: Remanency 主要指外加磁场移除后材料仍保留的磁性（剩磁/剩余磁化）。

definition.en: the magnetism that remains in a material after an external magnetic field is removed (also called remanence)
definition.zh: （磁学）外加磁场移除后，材料中仍然保留下来的磁性（也称为 remanence，剩磁/剩余磁化）

examples.en: Because of remanency, the iron core stays slightly magnetized even after the current is switched off.
examples.zh: 由于剩磁，电流关闭后铁芯仍会保持轻微的磁化。

examples.en: Engineers measure remanency to choose the right permanent magnet for a motor.
examples.zh: 工程师会测量剩磁来为电机选择合适的永磁体。

definition.en: the state of remaining or continuing after the main cause is gone (a less common, more general sense)
definition.zh: （较少用）在主要原因消失后仍然残留或持续存在的状态

examples.en: The remanency of old habits can make change feel slow.
examples.zh: 旧习惯的残留会让改变显得很慢。

extraExplanation: 在磁学里，remanency 常出现在“磁滞回线（hysteresis loop）”的语境中：当外加磁场降到零时，材料仍保留的磁感应强度常记作 Br（remanent flux density，剩余磁感应强度）。与之相关的另一个重要概念是 coercivity（矫顽力），表示把磁性降回零需要多强的反向磁场。
用词提示：在工程与物理文献中更常见的是 remanence；remanency 也对，但相对更偏技术写法。

summary.en: Remanent means “leftover/remaining,” and in physics it can mean “remaining magnetism after a magnetic field is removed.”
summary.zh: Remanent 表示“剩余的/残留的”；在物理中也可指“外磁场撤去后仍保留的磁性（剩磁）”。

definition.en: Remaining after the main part has been removed, used, or has happened; leftover.
definition.zh: （在主要部分被移除、使用或发生之后）剩余的；残留的。

examples.en: After the flood, remanent debris covered the streets.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，街道上到处都是残留的碎片。

examples.en: The lab analyzed remanent chemicals in the container.
examples.zh: 实验室分析了容器中残留的化学物质。

definition.en: (Physics/engineering) Remaining magnetism in a material after an external magnetic field is removed; remanence.
definition.zh: （物理/工程）外加磁场撤去后材料中仍保留的磁性；剩磁（剩磁强度）。

examples.en: Engineers measured the remanent magnetization of the sample.
examples.zh: 工程师测量了样品的剩磁（磁化强度）。

examples.en: High remanent values can affect sensor readings.
examples.zh: 较高的剩磁值可能会影响传感器读数。

extraExplanation: “remanent”在日常英语中不算常见，写作里更常用“remaining / residual / leftover”。但在材料科学、磁学等领域，“remanent (magnetization)”是标准术语，常与“coercivity（矫顽力）”一起出现，用来描述磁性材料的特性。

summary.en: Remanere is a Latin verb meaning “to remain / stay behind / be left,” sometimes used in scholarly or classical contexts.
summary.zh: Remanere 是拉丁语动词，意为“停留、留下、剩余”，多见于学术或古典引用语境。

definition.en: (Latin) to remain; to stay behind; to be left over.
definition.zh: （拉丁语）停留；留下；剩余。

examples.en: After the army marched on, a few soldiers remanere to guard the bridge.
examples.zh: 军队继续前进后，少数士兵留下守桥。

examples.en: Only fragments remanere of the original manuscript.
examples.zh: 原始手稿只剩下一些残片。

definition.en: (Figurative, Latin) to continue to exist; to endure.
definition.zh: （引申义，拉丁语）继续存在；持久。

examples.en: Even when empires fall, certain ideas remanere.
examples.zh: 即使帝国衰落，有些思想仍会长存。

examples.en: Her influence seemed to remanere in the community for years.
examples.zh: 她的影响似乎在社区里延续了多年。

extraExplanation: “remanere”是拉丁动词，由 re-（回、再）+ manere（停留、逗留）构成，核心意思就是“留下/仍在”。
它不是现代英语的常用词，但在古典文学、学术写作、法律/哲学引用或格言语境中，你可能会看到它以拉丁原文出现。日常英语更常用 remain / stay / be left.
相关常见拉丁词根 manere 也出现在英语词汇里，如 permanent（永久的，原义“始终停留的”）与 manor（庄园，历史上与“居住/停留之地”相关）。

summary.en: “Remanet” is mainly a Latin word meaning “(it) remains,” not a common modern English word.
summary.zh: “remanet”主要是拉丁语，意为“（它）仍然存在/仍将存在”，不是常见的现代英语词。

definition.en: (Not standard English) A Latin form meaning “(he/she/it) remains” or “will remain,” sometimes seen in mottos or older texts.
definition.zh: （非标准英语）拉丁语形式，意思是“（他/她/它）仍然存在/仍将存在”，有时出现在格言或较古老的文本中。

examples.en: The motto ends with “remanet,” meaning “it remains.”
examples.zh: 这句格言以“remanet”结尾，意思是“它仍然存在”。

examples.en: In some old inscriptions, “remanet” is used to say that something endures.
examples.zh: 在一些古老的铭文中，“remanet”用来表达某物会长久存在。

extraExplanation: “remanet”来自拉丁语动词“remanēre”（停留、仍然存在）。在现代英语写作中几乎不会单独使用；如果你想表达“遗留下来的部分/残余”，更常见的英语单词是“remnant”。如果你想说“仍然、继续存在”，常用“remain/remaining”。
如果你原本想输入的是英语单词，最可能的拼写是：remnant（残余）或 remain（仍然；留下）。你可以告诉我你看到它的句子，我能帮你判断是哪一个。

summary.en: “Remanie” is French (not standard English) meaning to rework/revise or reshuffle.
summary.zh: “remanie”是法语（非标准英语），意思是重新加工/修订，或改组/重组。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. In French, remanie (from remanier) means “to rework, revise, or reshuffle (something)”—for example, revising a text or reorganizing a team or government.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。法语 remanie（来自 remanier）常指“重新加工、修订、改动（某物）”，例如修改文本或对团队/政府进行改组。

examples.en: The editor asked the author to remanie the final chapter to make the ending clearer. (French-influenced usage)
examples.zh: 编辑要求作者“remanie”（重写/修订）最后一章，让结局更清楚。（法语影响用法）

examples.en: After the election, the prime minister announced a remanie of the cabinet. (More common in French)
examples.zh: 选举后，总理宣布对内阁进行一次“remanie”（改组/重组）。（在法语中更常见）

extraExplanation: 在英语写作里通常不要用 remanie；更自然的替代词是：revise（修订）、rework（返工/重做）、rewrite（重写）、reorganize/reshuffle（重组/洗牌）。
如果你在阅读艺术、出版或法国政治相关材料时看到 remanié/remanie，往往指“经过改写/重新编排的版本”或“内阁改组（cabinet reshuffle）”。

summary.en: Remanifest means to appear or become clear again, or to make something show again; in shipping, it can mean to submit a manifest again with updates.
summary.zh: Remanifest 指“再次显现/再度出现”或“使某事重新显现”；在航运中也可指“重新提交（更正后的）货单/舱单”。

definition.en: to show or become clear again; to appear again after disappearing or being hidden
definition.zh: 再次显现；再度出现；重新变得明显

examples.en: After a few quiet weeks, the conflict remanifested during the next meeting.
examples.zh: 平静了几周后，冲突在下一次会议上又重新显现出来。

examples.en: Her symptoms remanifested when she stopped taking the medicine.
examples.zh: 她停药后，症状又再次出现。

definition.en: to cause something to appear or become clear again; to bring back or show again
definition.zh: 使再次显现；让某事重新出现/变得明显

examples.en: The new report remanifested old concerns about safety.
examples.zh: 这份新报告让人们对安全的旧担忧再次浮现。

examples.en: The director remanifested the theme by repeating the same image at the end.
examples.zh: 导演在结尾重复同一画面，让主题再次凸显。

definition.en: (shipping/logistics) to prepare, file, or submit a manifest again, usually with corrections or updates
definition.zh: （航运/物流）重新制作或提交货单/舱单（通常为更正或更新）

examples.en: The carrier had to remanifest the cargo after the container numbers changed.
examples.zh: 集装箱编号变更后，承运人不得不重新提交舱单。

examples.en: Customs requested that the shipment be remanifested before clearance.
examples.zh: 海关要求在放行前重新制作并提交货单。

extraExplanation: “remanifest”由前缀 re-（再次）+ manifest（显现；货单）构成。日常英语里更常见的说法是 “appear again / reappear / resurface（再次出现）” 或 “become clear again（再次明朗）”。在航运与报关语境中，“re-manifest/ remanifest”更偏技术用语，指对舱单/货单进行重新申报或更正。

summary.en: Remanifestation means a renewed or repeated appearance—something becomes noticeable again.
summary.zh: Remanifestation 指“再次显现/再度呈现”，即某事物又一次变得可见或可察觉。

definition.en: the act or process of appearing again, or being shown again in a visible or noticeable way
definition.zh: 再次显现；再度呈现（以可见或可察觉的方式再次出现）

examples.en: Doctors watched for the remanifestation of symptoms after the medicine was stopped.
examples.zh: 停药后，医生观察症状是否会再次显现。

examples.en: The remanifestation of the conflict surprised many people who thought it was resolved.
examples.zh: 这场冲突的再度出现让许多以为问题已解决的人感到意外。

examples.en: In the novel, a storm’s remanifestation mirrors the return of the hero’s fears.
examples.zh: 在小说中，暴风雨的再度来临映照出主人公恐惧的回归。

extraExplanation: 这是一个相对少见、偏正式的名词，常见于学术写作（如医学、心理学、宗教/哲学讨论）中，用来强调“再次呈现/再度显露”的过程或结果。
构词上是 re-（再次）+ manifestation（显现、表现）。日常英语里更常用 reappearance（再出现）或 recurrence（复发/再发生），语气更自然。

summary.en: Remanipulate means to manipulate or process something again, often to refine or correct it.
summary.zh: Remanipulate 指对某物再次操控或再处理，常用于改进或修正。

definition.en: to manipulate again; to change, adjust, or handle something a second time (often to improve it, fix it, or produce a different result)
definition.zh: 再次操控/处理；对某物进行第二次调整、改动或操作（常为改进、修复或得到不同结果）

examples.en: After the first edit looked too harsh, the designer remanipulated the colors to make them softer.
examples.zh: 第一次编辑看起来太刺眼后，设计师再次调整了颜色，让它们更柔和。

examples.en: The technician remanipulated the controls to stabilize the machine.
examples.zh: 技术员再次操作控制装置，使机器稳定下来。

definition.en: (computing, data, images) to process or restructure again, especially by re-editing, reformatting, or re-running steps
definition.zh: （计算机/数据/图像）再次处理或重构，尤指重新编辑、重新格式化或重新执行步骤

examples.en: We had to remanipulate the dataset after removing duplicates.
examples.zh: 去除重复项后，我们不得不再次处理这份数据集。

examples.en: The photo was remanipulated for the print version.
examples.zh: 这张照片为了印刷版又被重新处理了一次。

extraExplanation: “remanipulate”由前缀 re-（“再、重新”）+ manipulate 组成，语感上偏正式、技术性，常见于写作中描述“再次加工/再处理”。日常口语里更常用 rework（返工/重新做）、adjust again（再调一下）、edit again（再编辑）等。

summary.en: Remanipulation means manipulating something again—reworking, readjusting, or reprocessing it.
summary.zh: Remanipulation 指“再次操控/再次处理”，即对某物重做、再调整或再加工。

definition.en: the act or process of manipulating something again, often to improve it, change it, or re-check results
definition.zh: 对某物再次进行操控、处理或调整的行为或过程，常用于改进、改变或复核结果

examples.en: The researcher performed a remanipulation of the data to confirm the findings.
examples.zh: 研究人员对数据进行了再次处理，以确认研究结果。

examples.en: After the first edit, the photo needed a careful remanipulation of color and contrast.
examples.zh: 第一次编辑后，这张照片还需要对色彩和对比度进行细致的再次调整。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 re-（“再次”）+ manipulation（“操控/处理”）构成，多见于学术写作、技术文档或正式语境。日常英语里更常用 rework（返工/重做）、adjust again（再调整）、redo（重做）等更自然的表达。
在科研语境中要注意：remanipulation 本身偏中性，表示“再次处理”；若要表达“不当篡改”，英语更常用 tampering 或 data manipulation（带负面含义）来强调问题。

summary.en: “Remanned” means “staffed again” (past form of reman), often used for ships, vehicles, bases, or posts.
summary.zh: “remanned”表示“重新配备人员/再次有人值守”，常用于船只、车辆、基地或岗位。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “reman”: to provide people for a job, vehicle, ship, or station again; to staff again (often after losses or a pause).
definition.zh: “reman”的过去式/过去分词：再次为某项工作、车辆、船只或岗位补充人员；重新配备人员（常用于损失或暂停之后）。

examples.en: After the storm, the rescue boat was remanned and sent back out.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，救援船重新配备了人员，再次出航。

examples.en: The base was quickly remanned after the unit returned from leave.
examples.zh: 部队休假归队后，基地很快重新补齐了人手。

definition.en: spelled as “re-manned” (with a hyphen) in some writing: staffed again; manned again.
definition.zh: 有时写作带连字符的“re-manned”：再次有人值守/再次配置人员。

examples.en: The checkpoint was re-manned once it was safe.
examples.zh: 确认安全后，检查站重新有人值守。

extraExplanation: “remanned / re-manned”多见于军事、航海、航空、安保等语境，意思是“重新配人手/重新值守”。在较正式或需要强调“再一次 man”的写作中，常用连字符 re-manned。
注意当代英语里，“man”有时会被认为不够性别中立。更中性的替代说法包括：“restaffed”（重新配备人员）、“recrewed”（重新配备机组/船员）、“reassigned personnel”（重新指派人员）。

summary.en: Remanning means putting workers back in place or staffing something again.
summary.zh: Remanning 指把岗位/团队再次配齐人手或重新派驻人员。

definition.en: the act of providing workers again or adding staff back to a position, team, or machine (often after a shortage or reduction).
definition.zh: 重新配备人手；恢复/补充人员（常指裁员、缺员后把岗位、团队或设备重新安排人手）。

examples.en: The airline started remanning the check-in counters after the holiday rush.
examples.zh: 节假日高峰过后，这家航空公司开始给值机柜台重新配备人手。

examples.en: Remanning the night shift reduced delays in production.
examples.zh: 给夜班重新补足人员后，生产延误减少了。

definition.en: to provide workers again; to staff or crew something again.
definition.zh: 重新派人/配人；再次为某处配备人员。

examples.en: They are remanning the station after repairs are finished.
examples.zh: 维修结束后，他们正在给这个站点重新派驻人员。

examples.en: The navy remanned the ship with a smaller crew.
examples.zh: 海军用更小的编制为这艘船重新配员。

extraExplanation: “remanning”比较少见，更常见的表达是“restaffing / re-staffing（重新配备人员）”或“recrewing（重新配员）”。在一些行业语境（如军事、航运、工厂排班、人力调度）里会看到“remanning”。
注意用词敏感性：现代英语里有时会避免用带“man”的词来泛指所有人员，改用“staff/crew/personnel”等更中性的表达。

summary.en: “Remans” most commonly means remanufactured parts/products (plural). It’s also often a misspelling of “remains.”
summary.zh: “remans”最常见指“再制造件/再制造产品”的复数；也常被当作“remains”的误拼。

definition.en: (Manufacturing) plural of reman: remanufactured parts or products (items rebuilt to “like-new” condition).
definition.zh: （制造业）reman 的复数：再制造的零件或产品（把旧件回收、修复/更换关键部件后，使其接近“如新”状态的产品）。

examples.en: The shop sells remans for trucks at a lower price than new parts.
examples.zh: 这家店卖卡车用的再制造件（remans），价格比全新件更便宜。

examples.en: If the alternator fails again, ask whether the replacement is new or a reman.
examples.zh: 如果发电机又坏了，问清楚更换的是全新的还是再制造件（reman）。

definition.en: A less common spelling/typing of “remains” (what is left), often seen as a misspelling.
definition.zh: “remains”（遗留物、剩余部分）的不常见拼写/输入错误形式，通常被视为拼写错误。

examples.en: Did you mean “remains” (what is left) instead of “remans”?
examples.zh: 你想写的是“remains”（剩下的/遗留的）而不是“remans”吗？

extraExplanation: 在汽车维修、工业零部件领域里，reman 是 remanufactured 的常见缩写（如 reman engine / reman alternator）。它和 refurbished（翻新）有时会混用，但严格来说再制造（remanufactured）通常有更标准化的工艺与质量检测。
如果你本来想表达“遗迹/遗体/残骸/剩余物”等含义，英语里更常用的是 remains。你也可以把原句发来，我可以帮你判断该用哪一个。

summary.en: Remantle is a rare verb meaning “to cover again.”
summary.zh: Remantle是个较少见的词，通常作动词，意思是“再次覆盖/重新包裹”。

definition.en: to cover or wrap again; to put a mantle (covering) on something again
definition.zh: 再次覆盖；重新披上（或加上）外衣/覆盖层

examples.en: After the repair, they remantled the pipes with insulation.
examples.zh: 维修后，他们重新给管道包上了保温层。

examples.en: Snow remantled the hills overnight.
examples.zh: 一夜之间，白雪又覆盖了山丘。

definition.en: (rare) a second covering or mantle; the act of covering again
definition.zh: （罕见）再次覆盖的外层；重新覆盖的行为

examples.en: The remantle of ash darkened the fields.
examples.zh: 再次覆盖的火山灰使田野变暗。

extraExplanation: “remantle”在现代英语中非常少见，更常见的表达是“cover again / re-cover / wrap again”。
很多人输入“remantle”其实是指澳大利亚西澳的港口城市“Fremantle”（弗里曼特尔）；如果你想查地名，拼写通常带开头的F。

summary.en: Remanufacture means to rebuild or produce a product again—often from used parts—so it meets like-new standards.
summary.zh: Remanufacture 指将产品（常由旧件）再制造/重建，使其达到接近或等同新品的标准。

definition.en: To manufacture something again, especially by rebuilding a used product to meet the same standards as a new one.
definition.zh: 再制造；翻新再生产（尤指把用过的产品重建到接近或达到新品标准）。

examples.en: The company remanufactures used car engines and sells them with a warranty.
examples.zh: 这家公司把二手汽车发动机再制造后出售，并提供保修。

examples.en: These printers are remanufactured, so they cost less than brand-new models.
examples.zh: 这些打印机是再制造的，所以比全新的机型更便宜。

definition.en: To produce again (something that has been made before), often in a new or improved form.
definition.zh: 再次生产（以前制造过的东西），常指以新的或改进的形式再生产。

examples.en: The factory remanufactured the part after the design was updated.
examples.zh: 设计更新后，工厂重新生产了这个零件。

examples.en: They remanufacture components to reduce waste and save materials.
examples.zh: 他们通过再生产零部件来减少浪费、节省材料。

extraExplanation: 在商业与环保语境中，remanufacture 常与“循环经济（circular economy）”相关：把旧产品拆解、清洁、检修、更换关键零件并重新组装，使性能达到或接近“与新品同等（like-new）”的标准。
与 repair（修理）/refurbish（翻新）相比：repair 通常只修好坏的部分；refurbish 多指清洁、美化、恢复可用；remanufacture 更强调按工业流程重建并达到规定的质量标准，常见于发动机、变速箱、电子设备等。

summary.en: “Remanufactured” means rebuilt from used items/parts to meet a standard, often performing like new.
summary.zh: “remanufactured”指把旧物/旧零件按标准拆解、修复并重建的“再制造”，常可达到接近全新的性能。

definition.en: Made again from used parts or a used product that has been taken apart, cleaned, repaired, tested, and rebuilt to meet a certain standard.
definition.zh: 用旧零件或旧产品拆解后清洁、修复、检测并重新组装，达到一定标准的“再制造”的。

examples.en: I bought a remanufactured engine that came with a one-year warranty.
examples.zh: 我买了一台再制造发动机，带一年保修。

examples.en: The company sells remanufactured printers that work like new but cost less.
examples.zh: 这家公司卖再制造的打印机，性能接近全新但价格更低。

definition.en: To remanufacture: to rebuild a used product so it can be used again, often to near-new performance.
definition.zh: 再制造：把旧产品重新制造/翻新重建，使其再次可用，性能常接近全新。

examples.en: These cartridges are remanufactured to reduce waste.
examples.zh: 这些墨盒通过再制造来减少浪费。

examples.en: The factory remanufactures returned parts and sells them at a discount.
examples.zh: 工厂把退回的零件再制造后打折出售。

extraExplanation: “remanufactured”常见于汽车零件（发动机、变速箱、刹车卡钳）、电子产品、打印耗材等。它通常比“refurbished（翻新）”更强调：拆解、替换磨损件、按工厂标准测试，流程更系统。
购买时可留意标注：warranty（保修）、certified（认证）、like-new performance（接近全新性能），以及是否说明更换了哪些关键部件。

summary.en: A remanufacturer rebuilds used products to like-new performance standards.
summary.zh: remanufacturer 指将旧产品再制造到接近新品性能标准的再制造商。

definition.en: A person or company that remanufactures products—taking used or worn items apart, repairing or replacing parts, and rebuilding them to meet the same (or very close to the same) performance standards as new items.
definition.zh: 再制造商；将旧/用过的产品拆解、修复或更换零件并重新组装，使其达到（或接近）新品性能标准的个人或公司。

examples.en: The remanufacturer rebuilt the engine to factory specifications.
examples.zh: 这家再制造商把发动机按原厂规格重新制造。

examples.en: We source our printer cartridges from a certified remanufacturer.
examples.zh: 我们的打印机墨盒来自一家经过认证的再制造商。

examples.en: The remanufacturer offers a warranty similar to new products.
examples.zh: 这家再制造商提供与新品类似的保修。

extraExplanation: “remanufacturer”常见于制造业、汽车零部件、打印耗材与工业设备领域。它与“refurbisher（翻新商）”不同：再制造通常要求更接近“像新的一样”的功能与标准，并常配套测试、质量控制与保修。
在可持续发展语境中，再制造被视为循环经济的一部分：通过延长产品寿命、减少原材料与能源消耗来降低环境影响。

summary.en: “Remanufactures” means either (1) makes used products like new again (verb), or (2) remanufactured products (plural noun).
summary.zh: “remanufactures”可指（1）进行再制造（动词第三人称单数），或（2）再制造产品（名词复数）。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular) makes a used product or part like new again by taking it apart, cleaning, repairing/replacing pieces, and testing it.
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）将旧产品或零件拆解、清洁、修复/更换部件并测试，使其恢复到接近全新状态。

examples.en: This factory remanufactures car engines and sells them with a warranty.
examples.zh: 这家工厂再制造汽车发动机，并提供质保销售。

examples.en: The company remanufactures returned printers to reduce waste.
examples.zh: 这家公司再制造退货的打印机，以减少浪费。

definition.en: (noun, plural) products that have been remanufactured; remanufactured items.
definition.zh: （名词复数）再制造产品；翻新并经再制造处理的物品。

examples.en: The store offers remanufactures at a lower price than new units.
examples.zh: 这家店提供再制造产品，价格比全新机更低。

examples.en: Some buyers prefer remanufactures because they’re cheaper and more sustainable.
examples.zh: 有些买家更喜欢再制造产品，因为更便宜也更环保。

extraExplanation: “remanufacture（再制造）”通常比“refurbish（翻新）”更严格：强调拆解、按标准更换关键部件、测试，目标是让性能接近或达到原厂标准；在汽车零件、工业设备、打印机墨盒等领域很常见。
词形提示：remanufacture = re-（再次）+ manufacture（制造）。你输入的“remanufactures”可能是动词第三人称单数（He remanufactures...），也可能是名词复数（These are remanufactures）。

summary.en: Remanufacturing is rebuilding used products to like-new condition through disassembly, repair/replacement, testing, and reassembly.
summary.zh: Remanufacturing（再制造）指把旧产品拆解、修复/换件、测试并重新组装，使其恢复到接近新品的过程。

definition.en: the process of restoring used products to a like-new condition by taking them apart, cleaning, repairing or replacing parts, testing, and rebuilding them
definition.zh: 将旧产品拆解、清洁、维修或更换零件、测试并重新组装，使其恢复到接近全新状态的过程（再制造）

examples.en: The company invests in remanufacturing to reduce waste and lower production costs.
examples.zh: 这家公司投资再制造，以减少浪费并降低生产成本。

examples.en: Remanufacturing engine parts can extend a vehicle’s life by years.
examples.zh: 对发动机零件进行再制造可以让车辆多用好几年。

examples.en: Many customers choose remanufacturing because it’s more affordable than buying new.
examples.zh: 很多顾客选择再制造产品，因为它比买新的更实惠。

extraExplanation: “remanufacturing（再制造）”通常比“recycling（回收）”更强调“保留产品的功能与价值”：回收往往把材料打碎再利用；再制造则把产品拆开、修复、检测后重新装回，目标是达到接近新品的性能标准。
常见搭配：remanufacturing program（再制造项目）、remanufactured parts（再制造零件）、remanufacturing facility/plant（再制造工厂）、design for remanufacturing（面向再制造的设计）。
在商业与法规语境中，“remanufactured（再制造的）”有时需要满足特定质量检测与标识要求，因此在采购或合同里常与“warranty（保修）”“quality standards（质量标准）”一起出现。

summary.en: Remanure means to fertilize land again using manure.
summary.zh: Remanure 指用粪肥对土地再次施肥。

definition.en: to add manure to (land or soil) again; to fertilize again with manure
definition.zh: 给（土地/土壤）再次施粪肥；再次用粪肥施肥

examples.en: After the harvest, the farmer remanured the field to restore nutrients.
examples.zh: 收割后，农民再次给田地施粪肥来恢复养分。

examples.en: If the soil is still poor, you may need to remanure it in spring.
examples.zh: 如果土壤仍然贫瘠，你可能需要在春天再施一次粪肥。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再、重新”，manure 作动词表示“施肥（尤其指施粪肥）”。“remanure”在现代英语中较少见，实际写作里更常用 re-fertilize（再次施肥）或 apply manure again（再次施粪肥）。
语境多出现在农业、园艺或土壤管理的讨论中，强调“第二次/再次”施用有机肥来补充氮、磷、钾等养分。

summary.en: Remap means to map again or change the mapping/assignment, especially in computing or planning.
summary.zh: Remap 指“重新映射/重新分配”，尤其常用于计算机或规划情境。

definition.en: To map again or differently; to change how something is arranged, assigned, or connected (often in computers, data, or planning).
definition.zh: 重新映射；改用不同方式映射/分配；重新规划（常用于电脑、数据或计划安排）。

examples.en: You can remap the keyboard so the Caps Lock key works as Ctrl.
examples.zh: 你可以重新映射键盘，让 Caps Lock 键变成 Ctrl。

examples.en: The app remapped the buttons to make the game easier to control.
examples.zh: 这个应用重新映射了按键，让游戏更好操作。

examples.en: After the new census, the city remapped its voting districts.
examples.zh: 新的普查之后，城市重新划分（重新映射）了选区。

definition.en: To make a new map of a place or area; to redraw maps using updated information.
definition.zh: 重新绘制地图；根据新信息重画某地的地图。

examples.en: The team remapped the coastline after the storm changed it.
examples.zh: 风暴改变了海岸线后，团队重新绘制了海岸地图。

examples.en: Researchers remapped the forest using satellite images.
examples.zh: 研究人员用卫星图像重新绘制了森林地图。

extraExplanation: “remap”由前缀 re-（再、重新）+ map（映射/地图）构成。日常英语里更常见于科技语境：例如 remap keys（重映射按键）、remap controls（改按键/手柄布局）、remap memory/ports（重映射内存/端口）、remap data（重新对应字段/标签）。在非科技语境也可指重新规划或重划分（如选区、路线）。

summary.en: “Remapped” means changed to a new mapping or assignment (often in computing), or describes something that has been reassigned/reconnected.
summary.zh: “remapped”指（常在计算机领域）把对应关系/分配方式重新设定；也可形容“已被重新映射/重新分配过的”。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of “remap”) to map again; to change how something is arranged, assigned, or connected—often in computing, data, or planning.
definition.zh: （remap 的过去式/过去分词）重新映射；重新分配/调整某物的对应关系、布局或连接方式（常用于计算机、数据或规划）。

examples.en: We remapped the keyboard shortcuts to make one-handed use easier.
examples.zh: 我们重新映射了键盘快捷键，让单手操作更方便。

examples.en: After the merge, the database IDs were remapped to avoid conflicts.
examples.zh: 合并后，为避免冲突，数据库的编号被重新映射了。

definition.en: Having been remapped; reassigned or reconnected according to a new map or scheme.
definition.zh: 已被重新映射的；按新的对应关系或方案重新分配/连接过的。

examples.en: The remapped controls feel more natural for new players.
examples.zh: 重新映射后的操作对新玩家来说更顺手。

examples.en: Some remapped network drives disappeared after the update.
examples.zh: 更新后，一些已重新映射的网络驱动器不见了。

extraExplanation: “remap”由 re-（再次）+ map（映射/绘制）组成，在软件与数据处理中很常见：比如把“旧编号/旧键位/旧路径”对应到“新编号/新键位/新路径”。
拼写规则：remap 以重读音节结尾且以辅音结尾，变过去式时双写 p → remapped（类似 stop→stopped）。

summary.en: Remapping means mapping again or changing an existing mapping/assignment, especially in computing or data.
summary.zh: Remapping 指“重新映射/重设对应关系”，常用于计算机与数据等语境。

definition.en: the act or process of mapping something again, or changing an existing map/assignment (especially in computing, data, or the brain)
definition.zh: 重新映射；对既有映射/分配关系进行调整（常见于计算机、数据或神经科学语境）

examples.en: The update requires remapping the keys to match the new layout.
examples.zh: 这次更新需要重新映射按键，以匹配新的布局。

examples.en: After the merger, the team did a remapping of customer IDs across databases.
examples.zh: 合并之后，团队对不同数据库中的客户ID做了重新映射。

examples.en: Therapists sometimes talk about neural remapping after an injury.
examples.zh: 治疗师有时会谈到受伤后的神经重新映射。

definition.en: to map again; to change how something is assigned or connected (for example, keys to actions, old values to new values)
definition.zh: 重新映射；更改某物的对应/分配/连接方式（例如按键与功能、旧值与新值的对应关系）

examples.en: You can remap the shortcut to open the settings faster.
examples.zh: 你可以重新映射快捷键，以更快打开设置。

examples.en: The script remaps missing values to zeros.
examples.zh: 这个脚本把缺失值重新映射为0。

extraExplanation: 在计算机领域，mapping 常指“对应关系/映射表”（如键盘按键→指令、旧字段→新字段、类别→数字编码）。remapping 往往意味着：保留原对象，但改变它们之间的对应关系。
常见搭配：key remapping（按键重映射）、memory remapping（内存重映射）、ID remapping（编号重映射）、value remapping（数值重映射）、neural remapping（神经重映射）。
词形来源：re-（再次）+ map（映射/绘制）。在技术写作里，remapping 常比 re-mapping 更常见，写作时注意保持一致。

summary.en: “Remaps” means maps again or changes an existing mapping, especially in computing (e.g., remapping keys or paths).
summary.zh: “remaps”表示重新绘制/重新建立映射关系，尤其常用于计算机语境（如重映射按键或路径）。

definition.en: to map again; to create a new map or representation of something (often after changes)
definition.zh: 重新绘制地图；重新建立对某事物的映射或表示（常指发生变化后）

examples.en: After the road construction, the city remaps the bus routes.
examples.zh: 道路施工后，城市会重新规划（映射）公交线路。

examples.en: The app remaps the controls so left-handed users can play comfortably.
examples.zh: 这个应用会重新映射控制键位，让左撇子用户也能舒适地使用。

definition.en: (computing) to assign a new relationship between inputs and outputs, such as keys, buttons, files, or memory addresses
definition.zh: （计算机）重新分配输入与输出之间的对应关系，如按键、按钮、文件或内存地址等的映射

examples.en: This tool remaps the keyboard shortcuts to match your workflow.
examples.zh: 这个工具会重新映射键盘快捷键，以符合你的工作流程。

examples.en: The system remaps the file paths after you move the project folder.
examples.zh: 你移动项目文件夹后，系统会重新映射文件路径。

extraExplanation: “remaps”通常是动词“remap”的第三人称单数（He/She/It remaps）或名词复数较少见。常见搭配：remap controls/keys（重映射按键）、remap routes（重新规划路线）、remap memory/address（重映射内存/地址）。

summary.en: Remarch means to march again or march back; it’s a rare, formal word mainly used in military or historical writing.
summary.zh: Remarch 指“再次行军”或“回头行军”，较正式且少见，多用于军事或历史语境。

definition.en: to march again; to march back to a previous place (rare in modern English)
definition.zh: 再次行军；回头行军（现代英语中较少用）

examples.en: After resting for an hour, the troops remarched to the front line.
examples.zh: 休息了一小时后，部队再次行军返回前线。
